Lack enough support: The claim does not provide a source for the data on female homicide rates in different countries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the rates of female homicide are solely related to domestic violence, but it does not specify this.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider other factors that could contribute to the difference in female homicide rates between countries.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that when considering all homicides, not just female homicides, the United States is not as far ahead of other countries.
Understate: The claim may understate the difference in female homicide rates by only comparing the United States to 24 other developed countries, rather than all developed countries.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not clearly specifying whether it is referring to all causes of homicide or just domestic violence homicide.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the difference in female homicide rates by using the phrase "outnumbers 24 other developed countries by more than 2½ to 1."
